post_text: Lake Educational Support Services Center Principal Don Harris is featured in the first segment of #MeetthePrincipal. Born and raised in Granite City, Harris attended Blackburn College and played football. He taught in Hazelwood for seven years, and is in his 15th year with the Granite City Community Unit School District #9.

SIU School of Dental Medicine is offering Free Dental Care for Kids Ages 3-13 on Oct. 12. Please call (618) 474-7200 to pre-register. Appointments will be accepted starting Sept. 1.

Children must be enrolled in their school’s free/reduced lunch program and be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian in order to receive treatment.

Maryville second-grade teachers Carolyn Pirtle and Michaela Genovese-Moss are going beyond the computer screen to stay connected during remote learning in the Granite City School District.

Similar to what Major League Baseball is doing with cutouts in the stands, Pirtle and Genovese-Moss have printed out a photo of each student and attached it to their chair in the classroom.

To the Granite City School District Parents/Guardians,
on August 18, 2020 at 3:30 pm Grades PreK - 8th your Students' Teacher and Schedule will be posted on Skyward. On August 21, 2020 at 3:30 pm Grade 9th - 12th your Students' Teacher and Schedule will be posted on Skyward.
If you have not Registered your child for the 20-21 school year, please do so.
Any questions regarding Enrollment / Registration please contact Student Services at 618-451-5800.
Any other questions please contact your Students School.

Thank you.

post_text:
We are happy that several Granite City High School students competed in the 10th Annual St. Louis Teen Talent Competition and Aubory Bugg advanced to the final round of the Competition! Everyone knows “The show must go on!” and this year the St. Louis Teen Talent Competition will “go on” during a special broadcast on NineNetwork/KETC on Monday, August 10, 2020 at 8 pm.

Immediately following the TV broadcast please join us for an After-Party event streaming on www.foxpacf.org. During the brief After-Party viewers can vote for their favorite act to win the Audience Choice Award ($1,000 cash)! The After-Party will be hosted by St. Louis Teen Talent Competition emcee Ben Nordstrom who will be joined by last year’s St. Louis Teen Talent Competition 1st Place Winner Joanna Serenko (also a recent competitor on The Voice) who will announce the winner of the Audience Choice Award at the end of the program.
text:
We are happy that several Granite City High School students competed in the 10th Annual St. Louis Teen Talent Competition and Aubory Bugg advanced to the final round of the Competition! Everyone knows “The show must go on!” and this year the St. Louis Teen Talent Competition will “go on” during a special broadcast on NineNetwork/KETC on Monday, August 10, 2020 at 8 pm.

Immediately following the TV broadcast please join us for an After-Party event streaming on www.foxpacf.org. During the brief After-Party viewers can vote for their favorite act to win the Audience Choice Award ($1,000 cash)! The After-Party will be hosted by St. Louis Teen Talent Competition emcee Ben Nordstrom who will be joined by last year’s St. Louis Teen Talent Competition 1st Place Winner Joanna Serenko (also a recent competitor on The Voice) who will announce the winner of the Audience Choice Award at the end of the program.

post_text:
2020 - 2021 DISTRICT ENROLLMENT AND REGISTRATION
Online Registration and Enrollment will begin June 1st.

For returning students, please take advantage of online registration by logging on to Skyward.

For those who need to prove residency or are new to enroll to the District, please note
(Due to Covid-19 and the guidelines we must follow, there will be a limited number of people allowed in the student services department.)

For information on what must be provided during Enrollment or Proof of Residency please visit our District Website.

The Student Service Department is located:
3200 Maryville Road
Granite City, IL 62040
We are open all summer long beginning June 1st from 7:30 AM - 3:00 PM

Any questions please call Student Services at 618-451-5800, OPT 1

https://www.gcsd9.net/userfiles/2/my%20files/registration%20information%202020%20-2021.pdf?id=5723

April 22 at 10:38 AM ·

GCHS 2020 May Carousel Court

Congratulations to the 98th GCHS May Carousel Court. May Carousel is a beautiful tradition dating back to 1923. While this year’s event cannot be held, the students who were named to this year’s court deserve recognition. These students were selected by the GCHS faculty. The Class of 2020 will be voting for this year’s Queen. The Queen will be announced this Friday and will receive her crown. Congratulations to all!!

post_text:
Attention GCHS Seniors

Jostens will be at Granite City High School main parking lot on Thursday, April 9th from 11 am to 2 pm distributing previously ordered graduation items. This will be a drive-thru pickup near the cafeteria. Orders must be paid in full before your items can be released. Jostens will accept payment for any outstanding balances at the time of pickup. No personal checks will be accepted, ONLY CASH or MONEY ORDER. Jostens will also be selling gown packets for seniors who have not ordered yet.

post_text:
The following is from Superintendent Greenwald:

Governor J.B. Pritzker just announced that the schools in Illinois will remain closed through April 30, 2020. We have anticipated this decision and have all been preparing diligently. We will remain being open from 730am-11am M-F, as we have been since the stay at home order has been in place. We are considered an essential business, and will continue to work in a safe manner, practice social distancing, and work remotely as much as possible. Today 3/31 begins our Remote Learning days which we have in place. Appropriate staff is working on this plan as we move forward. I appreciate everyone’s efforts during this challenging time in our world.
Respectfully,
Mr. Jim Greenwald
text:
The following is from Superintendent Greenwald:

We are considered an essential business, and will continue to work in a safe manner, practice social distancing, and work remotely as much as possible. Today 3/31 begins our Remote Learning days which we have in place. Appropriate staff is working on this plan as we move forward. I appreciate everyone’s efforts during this challenging time in our world.
Respectfully,
Mr. Jim Greenwald

post_text: Homework Packets will be available for pickup beginning Monday, March 30th. Please pick up packets at your child’s school. They will only be available, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday of next week, between the hours of 8 and 11 AM. Be aware you may not need a homework packet if your child’s teacher is utilizing an online tool to communicate. We ask that you continue to stay in contact with your teacher if you have any questions along with Skyward for any additional notifications.

post_text: Attention GCSD9 Families, the teachers are really missing their students! So as you are all at home this Thursday, the 26th the staff will be parading through as many streets as possible (while practicing social distancing, of course) honking and waving just to remind our students we are thinking of them & encouraging all to stay motivated during this stressful time. We would love to see lots smiling faces and waves through your windows & doors! GCPD, Special Investigator De Yong & your GCSD9 Staff will leave the high school around 11am and try their best to pass by as many families as possible. Hope to brighten your day GC students, we miss you!

post_text:
This is a classic example of our Granite City Community working together during this challenging time.

On Friday afternoon, Police Chief Ken Rozell reached out to the Granite City School District to request additional hand sanitizer. Within an hour, the Building and Grounds Department delivered the sanitizer to the Police Station and will continue delivering throughout the week.

post_text: Maryville School celebrated Dr. Seuss Week Monday, March 2 to Friday, March 6. Guest readers from the community read Dr. Seuss books to every classroom. Guest readers included GCSD9 Superintendent Jim Greenwald, School Board Member Linda Knogl, Members of the GCPD and GCFD, and New GCSD9 Superintendent Stephanie Cann. Read Across America Day, also known as Dr Seuss' Birthday, is a yearly observance in the USA inaugurated by the NEA (National Education Association). It is held on the school day that is nearest to 2 March, Dr. Seuss' birthday. Theodor Seuss Geisel was an American artist, book publisher, animator, poet, a political cartoonist as well as an author. He is best known for authoring over 60 children’s books. Students wore Cat in the Hat hats, wore crazy socks, wacky hair and Dr. Seuss T-shirts throughout the week. One first grader asked Principal Mark Lull if Dr. Seuss could come to Maryville for birthday cake!
text: Maryville School celebrated Dr. Seuss Week Monday, March 2 to Friday, March 6. Guest readers from the community read Dr. Seuss books to every classroom. Guest readers included GCSD9 Superintendent Jim Greenwald, School Board Member Linda Knogl, Members of the GCPD and GCFD, and New GCSD9 Superintendent Stephanie Cann. Read Across America Day, also known as Dr Seuss' Birthday, is a yearly observance in the USA inaugurated by the NEA (National Education Association). It is held on the school day that is nearest to 2 March, Dr. Seuss' birthday. Theodor Seuss Geisel was an American artist, book publisher, animator, poet, a political cartoonist as well as an author. He is best known for authoring over 60 children’s books. Students wore Cat in the Hat hats, wore crazy socks, wacky hair and Dr. Seuss T-shirts throughout the week. One first grader asked Principal Mark Lull if Dr. Seuss could come to Maryville for birthday cake!

post_text: Congratulations to our Warrior Hockey Team.... For the fifth time the Granite City Warriors are MVCHA champions. The Warriors captured the 2A crown Tuesday at the East Alton Ice Arena after coming from behind to beat Freeburg/Waterloo 6-2 in Game 2 of the championship series. GCHS swept the best-of-3 series 2-0.
text: Congratulations to our Warrior Hockey Team.... For the fifth time the Granite City Warriors are MVCHA champions. GCHS swept the best-of-3 series 2-0.

Last week Mrs Kristen Novacich - Koberna and I visited the schools and enjoyed presenting the Grow Granite Granite City Cinema perfect attendanceawards. The students are all shown with Mrs Kristen Novacich - Koberna the Director of Elementary Education, and their Principals Mrs Lisa Yarbrough Mitchell, Mr Mark Lull Maryville, Mrs Lisa Smith sub for Mr Jack Schooley Wilson, Mrs Terry Mitchell Frohardt, and Mr. Don Stratton Grigsby
The winners are,
Selena Lamas Frohardt
Mason Johnson Wilson
Jazmine Brendle Maryville
Alexis Aurand Grigsby
Cooper Boyer Mitchell

post_text:
The 13th Annual Holiday Production of

A Christmas Carol
Don't miss this year's production of Charles Dickens' holiday classic, A Christmas Carol.
This year’s production includes many surprise changes, cameo appearances and special effects. As always, our production includes students, teachers, administrators and residents throughout the Granite City Community. Several of our actors have participated in the production for thirteen years!
For additional production information, please see below, or contact the Theatre Department at john.manoogain@gcsd9.net.
Evening Performances:
Thursday, December 5, Friday, December 6, and Saturday, December 7, 7:00 p.m.
Matinee Performance: Sunday, December 8, 2:00 p.m.
Running Time: Approximately 60 – 75 minutes – no intermission Ticket Prices:
General Admission - $5.00; Reserved Seating - $10.00 (must be paid in advance of performance)
Thank You for your continued support of our Theatre Program.

post_text:
As Superintendent of Schools I'm thrilled on this historical day. Our two year journey of trips to visit other sources, meetings, question and answer sessions, reports to two different Boards, has become a reality.
Today we broke ground for the ground mount solar panels for our big solar energy program.

The first two schools in the plan for the ground mounts are Maryville and Wilson. This project is part of the new solar energy program generation in Illinois.
We will continue to share information moving forward.

This is a long term plan which will be very financially beneficial to the District, saving money on power bills.

Exciting times!
Mr JIm Greenwald
Superintendent of Schools

post_text: On Saturday, the GCHS Marching Warriors competed in the University of Illinois -ILLINOIS MARCHING BAND CHAMPIONSHIPS. The band had their best performance of the season earning First Place in Class 5A, along with the trophy for Best General Effect Performance. Congratulations Marching Warriors on an awesome show and an incredible marching season!! You make us very proud to be Warriors!!
